title: 103_hr3993
content: The "Child Sexual Abuse Prevention Act of 1994" may be cited as the short title. Penalties for international trafficking in child pornography are outlined in the Act. The "Child Sexual Abuse Prevention Act of 1994" outlines penalties for international trafficking in child pornography, including the production and importation of sexually explicit depictions of minors into the United States. The "Child Sexual Abuse Prevention Act of 1994" imposes penalties for trafficking in child pornography, including importing visual depictions of minors engaging in sexually explicit conduct into the United States. Offenders face fines, imprisonment up to 10 years, or both, with harsher penalties for repeat offenders. The "Child Sexual Abuse Prevention Act of 1994" imposes penalties for trafficking in child pornography, including importing visual depictions of minors engaging in sexually explicit conduct into the United States. Offenders face fines, imprisonment up to 20 years, or both. A technical amendment is made to the table of sections in chapter 110 of title 18, United States Code. The text discusses amendments to penalties for producing sexually explicit depictions of minors for importation into the United States under title 18, United States Code. The fines for violations are modified, and penalty enhancements are made for sections 2251 and 2252 of the code. Amendments are made to various sections of title 18, United States Code, including conspiracy and attempt provisions, RICO amendment, and transportation of minors for engaging in sexual acts with juveniles. Amendments to title 18, United States Code include provisions related to engaging in sexual acts with minors under 18 years of age, with penalties of fines, imprisonment up to 10 years, or both. The Congress urges states to enact laws prohibiting the production and possession of child pornography, with penalties including imprisonment and asset forfeiture.
